name: Spicy Apricot Loaf
author: Lindsay Perejma
summary: This is a great tea time bread. It's wholesome, spicy, lightly sweet and delicious.
directions: Place apricots and pineapple juice in a small saucepan
Warm over medium heat until bubbling
Remove from heat and set aside to cool
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Lightly grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan
In a large bowl, mix together whole wheat flour, all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, brown sugar, ginger, coriander and cinnamon
In a separate bowl, beat together egg, vegetable oil and buttermilk; combine with cooled apricot mixture
Gradually stir buttermilk/apricot mixture into flour mixture until blended
Pour batter into prepared 9x5 inch loaf pan
Bake in preheated oven for 50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into center of the loaf comes out clean
Let cool 5 minutes then loosen sides of loaf with a blunt knife
Remove from pan and allow to cool completely on a wire rack before slicing
